law.catch_line: Supervision during probation or conditional discharge.

text.section:
Any period of probation or conditional discharge required by the sentencing court to be served shall be supervised by:
The Department of Juvenile Justice, if the youthful offender is under the age of eighteen (18);
The Department of Corrections, upon the youthful offender attaining the age of eighteen (18); or
The designated representative of either of the above.
The Department of Juvenile Justice may make recommendations to the Circuit Court concerning the disposition of the youthful offender.

law.history: Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 534, sec. 17, effective July 14, 2000. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 624, effective July 15, 1998; and ch. 443, sec. 24, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 358, sec. 57, effective July 1, 1997. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 211, sec. 141, effective July 14, 1992. -- Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 423, sec. 138, effective July 1, 1987.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/98). This statute has been amended by 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 443 (making a substantive nonrevisory change) and ch. 426 (which made a name change due to reorganization and is revisory in nature). The nonrevisory change prevails. KRS 7.136(3).
